main_definition: To enjoy or have a preference for something, to find similarity between things, or as a verb used in informal speech to express agreement or affinity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To enjoy or take pleasure in something
meanings_and_examples.example: I really like the taste of chocolate.
She has a lot in common with her cousin; they are very much alike.

meanings_and_examples.definition: As a verb to express agreement or affinity, often used in informal speech
meanings_and_examples.example: I was like 'Wow!' when I saw the amazing view from the top of the mountain.
